If you are going for the sunset please dont go to the visitor centre. From visitor centre you can see view of the bridge (see picture below) and general view on the river. However you cannot see the sunset because it is being blocked by the tree. If you want to see the sunset in the horizon you need to walk to the other end where a wooden pathway is provided. You are literally walking on the wetland. However this place takes about 35 mins drive which means it will take approx 3060 mins walk depending on your pace. During this period (Feb 2023) it is very windy and very cold. So it might slow down your pace. So i drove to the carpark which is next to the entrance of the wooden pathway.
At first I was at the junction indicating P1 and P2. Not knowing where am I I took the P1 that says visitor centre. After realizing this is not the location I came out and paid 30NTD (it is 30NTDHr) and go for P2. I parked at P2 which charges 50NTD per stay and then realized it is still far in terms of walking. By the time I reached there the sun would have set already. It will take approx 20 mins walk from P2. Then I decided to drive all the way near the wooden pathway and there is a car park there charging 50NTD per day. The best way to find the place is to locate the chimney. It is on the left side of chimney.
The walk on the wetland is free. However for safety reason they will close the gates after sunset and also during some tides period. Check on the website for the sunset time and gate closing time before you leave.
